question: Weber's syndrome occurs due to lesions in the:-
exp: Weber's syndrome consists of an ipsilateral 3rd cranial N. paralysis with a contralateral hemiplegia due to a lesion in one half of the midbrain

question: 40 year old male with left side weakness and eye down and out. Where is the lesion.?
exp: Eye down and out - III nerve lesion - III nerve located in mid brain Left pyramid weakness - so lesion in contralateral side (right) -Medial lesion
